definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: Jingshan Park lies right to the north of the Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 景山公園坐落在故宮博物院的正北。

sentences.english: So, is Jingshan Park China’s answer to Hyde Park?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，中國的景山公園是另一個海德公園嗎？

sentences.english: I think I hear the answer calling out to me from Jingshan Park's dancing square.
sentences.chinese: 我想，在景山公園的舞蹈廣場裏，我聽到了答案。

sentences.english: Then driving to visit Jingshan Park and Beihai Park.
sentences.chinese: 然後開車到景山公園和北海公園參觀。
不管怎樣，我再繼續談景山公園。

sentences.english: Another worthwhile morning destination is Jingshan (Coal Hill) Park, behind the Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 另一個值得早上去的目的地是景山公園。

sentences.english: The view with the Jiangshan Park, the park near the Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 景山公園的景色啊，就是紫禁城附近的那個公園。

definition: Hong Kong Wetland Park, in Yuen Long, New Territories
pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Shi1 di4 Gong1 yuan2

definition: Chishang or Chihshang township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
Kenting National Park on the Hengchun Peninsula 恆春半島|恒春半岛[Heng2 chun1 Ban4 dao3], Pingtung county, south Taiwan
pinyin: Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2

definition: vehicle/(more specifically) mobility vehicle (mobility scooter, electric wheelchair, Segway etc)

pinyin: Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zhong1 xin1

definition: lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
Yongdingmen, front gate of the outer section of Beijing's old city wall, torn down in the 1950s and reconstructed in 2005
to bridge/to put up a bridge
